revised_title: Theories of Musical Intervals and Tones in the 17th Century
tldr: In this letter, Dr. John Wallis discusses the theories of musical intervals and tones as proposed by the Aristoxenians and Pythagoreans. He explains the differences between the two schools of thought and their methods of measuring musical intervals. Wallis also delves into the challenges of dividing the fourth and fifth intervals in an organ and the various ways they have been approached by musicians throughout history.
